analytic.title: A MEAN FIELD THEORY OF LAYER IV OF VISUAL CORTEX AND ITS APPLICATION TO ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORKS*

abstract.p: 683 A single cell theory for the development of selectivity and ocular dominance in visual cortex has been presented previously by Bienenstock, Cooper and Munrol. This has been extended to a network applicable to layer IV of visual cortex 2. In this paper we present a mean field approximation that captures in a fairly transparent manner the qualitative, and many of the quantitative, results of the network theory. Finally, we consider the application of this theory to artificial neural networks and show that a significant reduction in architectural complexity is possible.
